sen.j: 井上内親王（いのえ（いがみ）ないしんのう、養老元年（717年） - 宝亀6年4月27日 (旧暦)（775年5月30日））は第45代聖武天皇の第一皇女。
sen.e: >Imperial Princess Inoe (717 - May 30, 775) was the first Princess of the 45th Emperor Shomu.
Imperial Princess Inoe (717 - May 30, 775) was the first Princess of the 45th Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 余分な記号を削除しました。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Inoe (717 - May 30, 775) was the first Princess of the 45th Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 斎宮、のち第49代光仁天皇皇后。
sen.e: Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the ise shrine), later the empress of the 45th Emperor Konin.
She served as Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine) and later became the empress of the 45th Emperor Konin.
sen.cmt: 文章にしました。「斎宮」の説明内の伊勢神宮の表記を修正しました。
sen.e: She served as Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine) and later became the empress of the 45th Emperor Konin.

sen.j: 別名井上廃后、吉野皇后。
sen.e: Another name is Inoue Haigo or Yoshino empress.
Another name is Inoue Haigo (deposed empress) or Yoshino empress.
Another name is Inoue Haigo (deposed empress) or Yoshino empress.

sen.j: 養老5年（721年）9月11日 (旧暦)に五歳で伊勢の斎宮にト定される。
sen.e: She was appointed to Ise no saigu by fortune-telling on September 11, 721 (the old calendar).
She was appointed to Ise no saigu (Saigu of the Ise-jingu Shrine) by fortune-telling on October 10, 721 when she was five.
sen.cmt: 「伊勢の斎宮」の説明を補いました。「五歳で」の訳を補いしました。旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: She was appointed to Ise no saigu (Saigu of the Ise-jingu Shrine) by fortune-telling on October 10, 721 when she was five.

sen.j: 6年後の神亀4年（727年）、伊勢に下向する。
sen.e: She left the capital for Ise in 727, six years later.
She left the capital for Ise in 727, six years later.
She left the capital for Ise in 727, six years later.

sen.j: 天平16年（744年）1月13日 (旧暦)、弟の安積親王の死により、斎王の任を解かれ、退下する。
sen.e: On January 13, 744 (the old calendar), she was dismissed from the post of Saio and resigned after the death of her younger brother Prince Asaka.
On February 5, 744, she was dismissed from the post of Saio (high priestess) and resigned due to the death of her younger brother Prince Asaka.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。「斎王」の説明を補いました。言い回しを修正しました。旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: On February 5, 744, she was dismissed from the post of Saio (high priestess) and resigned due to the death of her younger brother Prince Asaka.

sen.j: 帰京後、白壁王（光仁天皇）の妃になる。
sen.e: After returning to Kyoto, she became the wife of Shirakabe no okimi (Emperor Konin).
After returning to Kyoto, she became the wife of Shirakabe no okimi (Emperor Konin).
After returning to Kyoto, she became the wife of Shirakabe no okimi (Emperor Konin).

sen.j: 天平19年（747年）、無品から二品に叙される。
sen.e: She was appointed from muhon to nihon in 747.
She was appointed from muhon (without a court rank) to nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes) in 747.
sen.cmt: 「無品」と「二品」の説明を補いました。
sen.e: She was appointed from muhon (without a court rank) to nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes) in 747.

sen.j: 天平勝宝6年（754年）、酒人内親王を産む。
sen.e: She gave birth to Imperial Princess Sakahito in 754.
She gave birth to Imperial Princess Sakahito in 754.
She gave birth to Imperial Princess Sakahito in 754.

sen.j: その後、他戸親王を産む。
sen.e: Then she gave birth to Imperial Prince Osabe.
Then she gave birth to Imperial Prince Osabe.
Then she gave birth to Imperial Prince Osabe.

sen.j: 光仁天皇が宝亀元年（770年）10月1日 (旧暦)に即位し、同年の11月6日 (旧暦)、皇后となる。
sen.e: Emperor Konin enthroned on October 1, 770 (the old calendar), and she became empress on November 6, in the same year.
Emperor Konin enthroned on October 27, 770, and she became empress on November 6, in the same year.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Emperor Konin enthroned on October 27, 770, and she became empress on November 6, in the same year.

sen.j: その翌年の宝亀2年（771年）の1月23日 (旧暦)、息子の他戸親王が立太子される。
sen.e: Her son Imperial Prince Osabe was formally installed as Crown Prince on January 23, 771 (the old calendar).
Her son Imperial Prince Osabe was formally installed as Crown Prince on February 16, 771 (the old calendar).
sen.cmt: 旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Her son Imperial Prince Osabe was formally installed as Crown Prince on February 16, 771.
sen.cmt: 西暦に修正しているので、(the old calendar)は不要なので削除しました。

sen.j: 宝亀3年（772年）3月2日 (旧暦)、光仁天皇を呪詛したとして皇后を廃され、同年の5月27日 (旧暦)には他戸親王も皇太子を廃され、二人は幽閉される事になった。
sen.e: She was released from the empress for the reason that she cursed Emperor Konin on March 2, 772 (the old calendar), Imperial Prince Osabe was also released from the crown prince on May 27, in the same year (the old calendar), and they were confined.

On April 13, 772, she was removed from empress for the reason that she cursed Emperor Konin and Imperial Prince Osabe was also released from the crown prince on July 6, in the same year, and they were confined.
sen.cmt: 時制が分かりやすいように語順を入れ替え、単語を変更しました。旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: On April 13, 772, she was removed from empress for the reason that she cursed Emperor Konin and Imperial Prince Osabe was also released from the crown prince on July 6, in the same year, and they were confined.

sen.j: 宝亀4年（773年）1月2日 (旧暦)には山部親王（後の桓武天皇）が立太子し、10月19日 (旧暦)、井上内親王と他戸親王は大和国宇智郡（現在の奈良県五條市）没官の邸に幽閉される。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kammu) was formally installed as Crown Prince on January 2, 773 (the old calendar), and Imperial Princess Inoe and Imperial Prince Osabe were confined in the house of confiscation in Uchi-gun, Yamato-no-kuni (present Gojo City, Nara Prefecture) on October 19 (the old calendar).
sen.cmt: 没官の邸はhouse of confiscationと訳しました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kanmu) was formally installed as Crown Prince on February 2, 773, and Imperial Princess Inoe and Imperial Prince Osabe were confined in a confiscated house in Uchi-gun, Yamato-no-kuni (present Gojo City, Nara Prefecture) on November 12.
sen.cmt: 桓武天皇の訳を訂正しました。「没官の邸」の訳を訂正しました。旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kanmu) was formally installed as Crown Prince on February 2, 773, and Imperial Princess Inoe and Imperial Prince Osabe were confined in a confiscated house in Uchi-gun, Yamato-no-kuni (present Gojo City, Nara Prefecture) on November 12.

sen.j: その後、井上内親王はやがて幽閉先で宝亀6年（775年）4月27日、息子の他戸王と共に逝去した。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Inoe and his son Imperial Prince Osabe died in the place where they were confined on April 27, 775 (the ancient calendar).
Imperial Princess Inoe and his son Imperial Prince Osabe died in the place where they were confined on June 3, 775.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Imperial Princess Inoe and his son Imperial Prince Osabe died in the place where they were confined on June 3, 775.

sen.j: この不自然な死には暗殺説も根強い。
sen.e: There is a theory that states that it was a murder because the deathof was unnatural.
There is a theory which states that they were murdered because their death was unnatural.
sen.cmt: 一つ目のthatをwhichに変えました。誤記を訂正し、文章を自然な流れになるように修正しました。
sen.e: There is a theory which states that they were murdered because their death was unnatural.

sen.j: すでに息子の他戸親王は立太子され、井上内親王が老齢の夫、光仁天皇を呪ったとは、信じ難い所がある。
sen.e: >It was unbelievable that Imperial Princess Inoe cursed her old-aged husband, Emperor Konin, because Imperial Prince Osabe was already formally installed as Crown Prince.
It is unbelievable that Imperial Princess Inoe cursed her old-aged husband, Emperor Konin, because Imperial Prince Osabe was already formally installed as Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 余分な記号を削除しました。時制を訂正しました。
sen.e: It is unbelievable that Imperial Princess Inoe cursed her old-aged husband, Emperor Konin, because Imperial Prince Osabe was already formally installed as Crown Prince.

sen.j: ましてや井上内親王は、かつては斎王という神に仕えていた身である。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Inoe served God named Saio.
All the more because Imperial Princess Inoe served God as Saio.
sen.cmt: 誤訳を訂正し、「ましてや」の英訳を補いました。
sen.e: All the more because Imperial Princess Inoe served God as Saio.

sen.j: さらに、宝亀3年（772年）、母の井上内親王と他戸親王の廃后と廃太子事件のあった後の11月13日 (旧暦)、俄かに井上内親王の娘の酒人内親王が19歳で伊勢の斎王にト定されており、この事件と酒人内親王の斎王ト定は連動していた可能性がある。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Sakahito, was appointed to Ise no Saio at the age of 19 suddenly on November 13, 772 (the old calendar), after the deposition of the mother Imperial Princess Inoe and Imperial Prince Osabe, a daughter of Imperial Princess Inoe, and there is a possibility that the incident was related to the appointment of Imperial Princess Sakahito to Saio.

Imperial Princess Sakahito (the daughter of Imperial Princess Inoe) was suddenly appointed to Ise no Saio (Saio of the Ise-jingu Shrine) at the age of 19 on December 15, 772, after the deposition of her mother Imperial Princess Inoe as empress and Imperial Prince Osabe as crown prince, a daughter of Imperial Princess Inoe, and there is a possibility that the incident was related to the appointment of Imperial Princess Sakahito to Saio.
sen.cmt: 「伊勢の斎王」の訳を補いました。「廃后」「廃太子」の訳を補いました。語順を入れ替えました。旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Imperial Princess Sakahito (the daughter of Imperial Princess Inoe) was suddenly appointed to Ise no Saio (Saio of the Ise-jingu Shrine) at the age of 19 on December 15, 772, after the deposition of her mother Imperial Princess Inoe as empress and Imperial Prince Osabe as crown prince, a daughter of Imperial Princess Inoe, and there is a possibility that the incident was related to the appointment of Imperial Princess Sakahito to Saio.

sen.j: また、井上内親王の立后と他戸親王の立太子に尽力したと言われている左大臣藤原永手が宝亀2年（771年）の2月21日 (旧暦)に他界して、藤原氏内部における藤原北家から藤原式家への政権移動があったことも注目すべき事柄である。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nagate, Minister of the Left, who is said to make efforts to the investiture of the Imperial Princess Inoe and the investiture of the Crown Prince Osabe died on February 21, 771 (the ancient calendar) and the regime changed from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan to the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan.

FUJIWARA no Nagate, Minister of the Left, who is said to have made efforts for the investiture of the Imperial Princess Inoe and the investiture of the Crown Prince Osabe, died on March 15, 771 and the regime shifted from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan to the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, which is also worth paying attention.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。旧暦を西暦に直しました。ご参考→http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nagate, Minister of the Left, who is said to have made efforts for the investiture of the Imperial Princess Inoe and the investiture of the Crown Prince Osabe, died on March 15, 771 and the regime shifted from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan to the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, which is also worth paying attention.

sen.j: 井上内親王の光仁天皇呪詛事件は、山部親王の立太子をもくろむ藤原良継や藤原百川ら藤原式家一派の陰謀だと（あるいは彼らの政治的圧力によって内親王が追い詰められた結果とも）いう説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that states that the Emperor Konin curse incident by Imperial Princess Inoe was an plot of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, such as FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Momokawa, who attempted to install Imperial Prince Yamanobe as the Crown Prince (or the Imperial Princess was turned to bay by their political power).

There is a theory which states that the incident of Imperial Princess Inoe's curse on Emperor Konin was a plot of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, such as FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Momokawa, who attempted to install Imperial Prince Yamanobe as the Crown Prince (or that the Imperial Princess was brought to bay by their political power).
sen.cmt: 語順を修正しました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: There is a theory which states that the incident of Imperial Princess Inoe's curse on Emperor Konin was a plot of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, such as FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Momokawa, who attempted to install Imperial Prince Yamanobe as the Crown Prince (or that the Imperial Princess was brought to bay by their political power).

sen.j: （『水鏡』では、光仁天皇が皇后と賭け事で「自分が勝ったら后に絶世の美女を紹介してもらおう。自分が負けたら后に若く逞しい男性を与えよう」と言い、結果皇后の勝ちであったために息子の山部親王（後の桓武天皇）を差し出したところ、皇后が若い親王に夢中になってしまったのが事件の原因であるという話が見える）
sen.e: "Mizu Kagami" (The Water Mirror)" contains a story that Emperor Konin told the empress that if I won, give me a lady of great beauty as empress. If I lost, a young and strong man was given to the empress. The empress won, and his son Imperial Prince Yamanobe was introduced to her, and she was attracted to the young prince, causing the incident.

("Mizu Kagami" [The Water Mirror] contains a story that Emperor Konin told the empress, 'if I win, you give me a lady of great beauty. If I loose, I give you a young and strong man,' and the empress won, so his son Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kanmu) was introduced to her, and she got so attracted to the young prince, causing the incident.
sen.cmt: ()内の文章が分かれていましたので、統合しました。記号、時制、文法、言い回しを訂正しました。
sen.e: ("Mizu Kagami" [The Water Mirror] contains a story that Emperor Konin told the empress, 'if I win, you give me a lady of great beauty. If I loose, I give you a young and strong man,' and the empress won, so his son Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kanmu) was introduced to her, and she got so attracted to the young prince, causing the incident.

sen.j: なお、『一代要記』によれば他戸親王は井上内親王の母と同族の女嬬・県犬養宿禰勇耳の産んだ息子で、井上内親王が引き取り、我が子として育てたという説もある。
sen.e: According to "Ichidai Yoki" (summary chronicle of each reign), Imperial Prince Osabe was a son who were given birth by Nyoju 県犬養宿禰勇耳Agata no Inu Kai no Sukune Isamimi, who was in the same family as the mother of Imperial Prince Inoe, and Inoe took care of him as his son.

According to "Ichidai Yoki" (summary chronicle of each reign), Imperial Prince Osabe was a son who was given birth by Nyoju (court lady who serves in the inner palace) Agata no Inu Kai no Sukune Isamimi who was in the same family as the mother of Imperial Prince Inoe, and Imperial Prince Inoe took care of him as his son.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。漢字を削除しました。「女嬬」の説明を補いました。
sen.e: According to "Ichidai Yoki" (summary chronicle of each reign), Imperial Prince Osabe was a son who was given birth by Nyoju (court lady who serves in the inner palace) Agata no Inu Kai no Sukune Isamimi who was in the same family as the mother of Imperial Prince Inoe, and Imperial Prince Inoe took care of him as his son.

sen.j: 宝亀7年（776年）から天災地変がしきりに起こり、廃后・廃太子の怨霊と恐れられ、また廃后は竜になったという噂が立った。
sen.e: Natural disasters occurred frequently after 776, and they were dreaded as acts of the revengeful ghosts of the empress and crown prince and a rumor started that the empress became a dragon.

Natural disasters occurred frequently after 776, and they were dreaded as the acts of the revengeful ghosts of the deposed empress and the deposed crown prince and a rumor started to circulate that the empress became a dragon.
sen.cmt: 廃后・廃太子の訳を補いました。「噂が立った」の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: Natural disasters occurred frequently after 776, and they were dreaded as the acts of the revengeful ghosts of the deposed empress and the deposed crown prince and a rumor started to circulate that the empress became a dragon.

sen.j: 同8年（777年）、光仁天皇は遺骨を改葬させ、墓を御墓と追称。
sen.e: Emperor Konin reburied their remains and renamed their graves respectfully in 777.
Emperor Konin reburied their remains and renamed their graves respectfully in 777.
Emperor Konin reburied their remains and renamed their graves respectfully in 777.

sen.j: さらに延暦19年（800年）、崇道天皇（早良親王）の名誉回復にあわせ、井上内親王を皇后と追号し、御墓を山陵と追称する。
sen.e: In addition, Imperial Princess Inoe was given a title of empress and renamed her grave an imperial tomb to restore the impaired reputation of Emperor Sudo (Imperial Prince Sawara) in 800.

In addition, Imperial Princess Inoe was given a title of empress and her grave was renamed to become an imperial tomb at the occasion of restoring the impaired reputation of Emperor Sudo (Imperial Prince Sawara) in 800.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、「崇道天皇（早良親王）の名誉回復にあわせ、」の訳を訂正しました。
sen.e: In addition, Imperial Princess Inoe was given a title of empress and her grave was renamed to become an imperial tomb at the occasion of restoring the impaired reputation of Emperor Sudo (Imperial Prince Sawara) in 800.

sen.j: 陵墓は奈良県五條市御山町の宇智陵と比定されている。
sen.e: The imperial mausoleum was found to be located in Uchiryo in Kumiyama-cho, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture.
Her imperial mausoleum is identified to be the Uchi no Misasagi Mausoleum in Kumiyama-cho, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 宇智陵はUchi no Misasagi Mausoleumとしました。
sen.e: Her imperial mausoleum is identified to be the Uchi no Misasagi Mausoleum in Kumiyama-cho, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: のちに霊安寺御霊神社に祀られた。
sen.e: She was later deified in the Ryoan-ji Goryo-jinja Shrine.
She was later deitied in the Ryoan-ji Goryo-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: She was later deitied in the Ryoan-ji Goryo-jinja Shrine.
